text: hi this is iris X I'm the co-writer and
director of love is strange you might go
to the library this is very early in the
film and we we don't actually know what
what's quite happening someone has
arrived in this home and this is Marissa
Tomei playing a novelist her teenage son
Charlie tahan is a wonderful discovery
in the film and they have a new arrival
and and and we don't yet know who's
going to arrive the film has a certain
amount of suspense throughout it in
terms of how these characters are going
to interplay with each other and and in
this moment what we discover is in the
bottom of a bunk bed sits the great
actor John Lithgow who has moved in
slightly unwanted certainly unexpected
to the family and I think what I
benefited from in this scene is that you
have these extraordinary comic actors
and it was something I didn't think of
when I really cast Marissa and John but
their timing is so impeccable and what
what's going on here is really the
entire movie the three generations who
are all in one home trying to figure out
how to live with each other and coexist
when I first started working on the film
I was living alone and within a two-week
period I was now living with my husband
our two babies the baby's mother and
occasional visiting family members so I
really understood the idea of how in one
small New York apartment you could find
three generations and and and also a
kind of the emotional epic of what that
is in a very kind of tiny scenario so
what's this presentation you're working
on
Oh
